extendedInfo.description: A fun Shape Matching Game for Kids and Toddlers - Food, Farm and Outfit EditionThis fun app will keep your kids busy. A simple and fun matching games for toddlers!Match all the colourful outfits, the tasty food and the cute animals with the shape of the object in the middle of the game! Toddlers and kids will develop their visual perception and cognitive skills. The simple drag & drop mechanism also helps to train the fine motor skills of your kid. The game interface is kid-friendly and does not overload your kid with too many stimuli. Within three different themes, over 50 different objects can be matched one after another. Each game has a nicely illustrated image with 8 related images around. Just drag the matching object into the middle of the screen. Features of Shape Matching for Toddlers: â¢ A fun shape matching game puzzle for little kids (ages 2+)â¢ kid-friendly sounds and graphicsâ¢ trains fine motor skillsâ¢ develops cognitive skillsâ¢ three different themes (Food, Farm and Colorful Outfits)Shape Matching for Toddlers offers three different themes: Farm: Apple, farmer, flower, bush, duck, grass, pitchfork, hat, cow, pig, butterfly, barn, sheep, boots, fenceFood and beverages: Apple, banana, pear, gloves, glass, cheese, lemonade, melon, oven, soup, pot, lemonOutfits: Boots, glasses, pants, hat, jacket, boy, dress, girl, cap, pullover, earlap, sweater, scarf, bow, socks, bag, shirtAll three themes of Shape Matching for Toddlers (farm, food and beverages, outfits) are free! A great game for children who are curious to learn and match different items.Age group: 2 +Keywords: baby, pairs, images, preschool, match, 3, food, drag, drop, autism, child, puzzle, memory, memo, fine, motor, skills, matchup, shapes, puzzles, shape puzzle, jigsaw, riddle, Easter

reviews.title: Please fix!!
reviews.comment: My son drags an image to match it and it flies of screen and can\'t be matched, ruining the game and causing him to get upset. Please make it so the images don\'t just float off! otherwise this  game would\'ve gotten 5 stars. :/
reviews.author: Liz Mauffray
